docs.abstract: To Save and Project, the annual MoMA series, unearths forgotten work by Australian women, a French auteur and even George A. Romero.
docs.snippet: To Save and Project, the annual MoMA series, unearths forgotten work by Australian women, a French auteur and even George A. Romero.
docs.lead_paragraph: Just because movies spent more than a century as physical objects — as strips of film, not the digital files of the 21st century — doesn’t mean they can’t disappear. And their loss, to decomposition or to memory, inevitably leaves gaps in knowledge.

headline.main: This Festival Could Alter Your Sense of Film History
headline.print_headline: Changing Your Sense Of Cinematic History

docs.lead_paragraph: Overlooked is a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths were given little notice by The Times.

headline.main: Overlooked No More: Margaret McFarland, Mentor to Mister Rogers
headline.print_headline: Overlooked No More: Margaret McFarland, Mentor to Mister Rogers

docs.abstract: Critics see a concerted effort to shift blame, protect conservative leaders and divert attention from climate change.
docs.snippet: Critics see a concerted effort to shift blame, protect conservative leaders and divert attention from climate change.
docs.lead_paragraph: WOMBEYAN CAVES, Australia — Deep in the burning forests south of Sydney this week, volunteer firefighters were clearing a track through the woods, hoping to hold back a nearby blaze, when one of them shouted over the crunching of bulldozers.

headline.main: How Rupert Murdoch Is Influencing Australia’s Bushfire Debate
headline.print_headline: Murdoch Adds Fuel to Debate on Australia’s Fires

docs.abstract: Near the country’s southern coast, where Montevideo and Punta del Este lure tourists, prices remain attractive despite steady increases.
docs.snippet: Near the country’s southern coast, where Montevideo and Punta del Este lure tourists, prices remain attractive despite steady increases.
docs.lead_paragraph: This two bedroom, two-bathroom house sits on 12.4 acres outside the town of Pueblo Edén, Uruguay, about 25 miles north of the coastal resort of Punta del Este and 80 miles east of the nation’s capital, Montevideo.

headline.main: House Hunting in Uruguay: A Modern Ranch on 12 Acres for $390,000
headline.print_headline: Car Wheels on a Gravel Road Lead to Exhilarating Views

docs.abstract: A new genetic engineering technology could help eliminate malaria and stave off extinctions — if humanity decides to unleash it.
docs.snippet: A new genetic engineering technology could help eliminate malaria and stave off extinctions — if humanity decides to unleash it.
docs.lead_paragraph: One early summer evening in 2018, the biologist Anthony James drove from his office at the University of California, Irvine, to the headquarters of the Creative Artists Agency, a sleek glass-and-steel high-rise in Los Angeles. There, roughly 200 writers, directors and producers — many of them involved in the making of science-and-technology thrillers — were gathered for an event called Science Speed Dating, where James and other scientists would explain their work. The sessions were organized, James told me, “in hopes of getting the facts at least somewhat straight.”

headline.main: The Gene Drive Dilemma: We Can Alter Entire Species, but Should We?

docs.abstract: Four new books show how being nice — and being on the receiving end of thoughtfulness — will drastically improve life for all involved.
docs.snippet: Four new books show how being nice — and being on the receiving end of thoughtfulness — will drastically improve life for all involved.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was New Year’s Eve, and my friends had just adopted a little girl, 4 years old, from China. The family was going around the table, suggesting what each thought the New Year’s resolution should be for the other. Fei Fei’s English was still shaky. When her turn came, though, she didn’t hesitate. She pointed at her new father, mother and sister in turn. “Be nice, be nice, be nice,” she said.

headline.main: You’re Not Going to Kill Them With Kindness. You’ll Do Just the Opposite.
